input_text:
Job Title: Senior Lease Analyst (140994)

Location: Ridgewood, NJ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Sales

Description:
Our client, a commercial real estate company in Bergen County with a great culture and tons of growth opportunity is seeking a Senior Lease Analyst to join their team.

Salary/Hourly Rate

$80,000 – $90,000

Position Overview

The Senior Lease Analyst will review lease contracts to ensure they are accurate and meet all the required terms. The Senior Lease Analyst upholds the integrity of real estate portfolio data for large, complex portfolio of clients.

Responsibilities Of The Senior Lease Analyst

 Prepare and review monthly account reconciliations and analyze variances Inputs, maintains, organizes and reports on information regarding lease dates, dollar values and financial accounting transactions into a lease management software database Manage relationships and liaise with external customers (Operations and Finance team, auditors) Prepares, processes and reconciles AR & AP transactions to ensure accurate and current lease information is maintained Resolves critical issues for clients by researching and gathering information about payment transactions, lease terms and other relevant items Establishes and maintains working relationship with clients and/or landlords Prepares lease abstracts and edits them for accuracy Writes narratives for monthly variance reports, providing analysis and interpretation of lease information to clients Prepares invoices for subtenants, reconciles subtenant accounts, reviews incoming invoices for errors/accuracy with lease document and ensures correct coding

Qualifications For The Senior Lease Analyst

 2 to 3 years of progressive real estate Leasing experience Proficiency in MS Excel

Education Requirements

 Bachelor’s degree or higher is required

Benefits

 Medical, Dental, and Vision 401k

 As a woman-owned firm, we value diversity. We are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and will consider all applications without regard to race, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation and gender identity), age, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, veteran status, disability (physical or mental), genetic information, citizenship or any other characteristic protected by law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Candidates who apply for roles through the Atrium website will be added to our candidate pool and may be considered for additional roles of a similar title. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

EOE/M/F/D/V/SO 

Position ID: 140994

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

Prepares, processes and reconciles AR & AP transactions to ensure accurate and current lease information is maintained

Prepares invoices for subtenants, reconciles subtenant accounts, reviews incoming invoices for errors/accuracy with lease document and ensures correct coding
